title: Westlock County
text:
Westlock County is a <a href="List%20of%20municipal%20districts%20in%20Alberta">municipal district</a> in <a href="central%20Alberta">central Alberta</a>, Canada that is north of <a href="Edmonton">Edmonton</a>. The county was formerly known as the Municipal District of Westlock No. 92, and was created in 1943 from the merger of five smaller municipal districts.
The county lies on the boundary of two of Canada's largest watershed basins. To the north is the <a href="Athabasca%20River">Athabasca River</a>, which drains into the <a href="Arctic%20Ocean">Arctic Ocean</a> via the <a href="Mackenzie%20River">Mackenzie River</a>. To the south is the <a href="Sturgeon%20River%20%28Alberta%29">Sturgeon River</a> which drains via the <a href="North%20Saskatchewan">North Saskatchewan</a> into <a href="Hudson%20Bay">Hudson Bay</a>.
Geography.
Communities and localities.
The following <a href="List%20of%20municipalities%20in%20Alberta%23Urban%20municipalities">urban municipalities</a> are surrounded by Westlock County.
The following <a href="Hamlet%20%28place%29">hamlets</a> are located within Westlock County.
The following <a href="List%20of%20localities%20in%20Alberta">localities</a> are located within Westlock County.
Demographics.
In the <a href="Canada%202016%20Census">2016 Census of Population</a> conducted by <a href="Statistics%20Canada">Statistics Canada</a>, Westlock County recorded a population of 7,220 living in 2,670 of its 3,009 total private dwellings, a change from its 2011 population of 7,644. With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2016.
In the <a href="Canada%202011%20Census">2011 Census</a>, Westlock County had a population of 7,644 living in 2,696 of its 2,925 total dwellings, a 10.6% change from its 2006 population of 6,910. With a land area of , it had a population density of in 2011.
Government.
The municipal government consists of a <a href="Reeve%20%28Canada%29">reeve</a> and six other elected <a href="councillors">councillors</a> who work with a permanent staff of 32.
Education.
The county is within the <a href="Pembina%20Hills%20Public%20Schools">Pembina Hills Public Schools</a>, which formed in 1995 as a merger of three school districts.
